newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Manuel to deal with S.Africa fx controls - Mandela.
newsitem.headline: Manuel to deal with S.Africa fx controls - Mandela.

text.p: Finance Minister Trevor Manuel will deal fully with the issue of relaxing South African foreign exchange controls, President Nelson Mandela said on Monday.

Mandela, interviewed by state television, would not be drawn on the timing or nature of the next steps to ease restrictions on capital movement, but reiterated that the government was committed to the phased withdrawal of controls.
"This is a question that is going to be dealt with fully by the Minister of Finance and I would not like to steal his show," Mandela said.

"He will deal with the matter -- but I have indicated in my (opening of parliament) speech on Friday that we are committed to the gradual phasing out of exchnage controls. Details will be given by him."
Mandela made no comment when asked whether an announcement would come at the time of the March 12 budget as many market commentators have speculated.
